IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: On 04/22/2023 at 1440 hours, I, Trooper Bowling, currently assigned to the College Park Barrack, uploaded the witness statement forms, ACRS report, and added the vehicles and people involved in the Fatal Collision on I-95 northbound at MD-200 to the initial report.

Detailed Crash Investigation Report (For review by the MSPCrash Team) Section I. - Introduction: On Friday, April 21, 2023, at approximately 2128hours, the Maryland State Police College Park Barrack received a call of a motor vehicle collision involving two vehicles and a pedestrian. Due to the nature of the collision, I, Trooper First Class B. White #6931, an Advanced Collision Investigator (ACI) assigned to the Forestville Barrack, was requested to respond to assume the investigation. Upon my arrival at the scene, I observed Prince Georges County Fire Department and Paramedics were clearing the scene. Maryland State College Park Barrack Troopers had lanes number one (1) through four (4) shut down. The collision involved two vehicles: a silver Toyota Camry bearing Maryland registration 2EF0570 operated by Moctar Moustapha Tall (African American/male, DOB:06/14/1998), of Rockville, Maryland, and a black Ford Explorer bearing Maryland registration 7ew9219 operated by Darrell William Brooks Sr. (African American/male, DOB: 4/23/1995), of Randallstown, Maryland. The silver Toyota was positionedon the left shoulder of the roadway and the black Ford Explorer was positioned in lane number 2. The pedestrian, Mark Anthony Bumbry (African American/male, DOB: 07/18/1961) was positioned in front of the Ford Explorer in lane number 2. No witnesses remained on scene. I then proceeded to process and document the scene and take digital photographs. Section II. - Scene Description: (The following descriptions are based on the area where the collision occurred.) Primary Roadway: Interstate 95 (I-95) was a divided highway that traveled in a north/south direction. The northbound lanes were separated from the southbound lanes by a grassy center median affixed with aguardrail.The northbound side of Interstate 95 was a four-lane highway. Each lane was separated by a broken white lane line. Lane number 1 was separated from lane number 2 by a broken white lane line. Lane number 2 was separated from lane number 3 by a broken white lane line. And lane number 3 was separated from lane number 4 by a broken white lane line. The roadway was essentially straight and level. The road markings appeared to be bright and in good condition. The road surface was dry and appeared to be free from any contributory defects. The posted speed limit was 65 miles-per-hour. Secondary Roadway (if applicable): N/A Environmental Conditions: The weather conditions at the time of the collision were dark skies/partly cloudy. The collision occurred during the night hours. There were streetlights present in the direct area where the collision occurred. There did not appear to be any visible sight obstructions that could have contributed to this collision.I then checked Weather Underground which provides historical weather data. Sunset was at 1951 hours and the skies were clear. The astronomy at the time of the collision was a waxing crescent moon.A waxing crescent moon is generally 92% invisible. Since the astronomy was a waxing crescent moon, there would have been a lack of moonlight reflectivity which could have illuminated the area more. Section III. - Scene Evidence: I surveyed the scene in an effort to locate, identify, and analyze any roadway evidence which would be useful in the investigation. I did not observe any evidence of pre-impact tire marks or cleaning marks.A gouge mark from the areaof impact was not observed. The deceased finger was located approximately 305 feet from where vehicle 2 came to final rest, in lane number 2, and 628 feet from where vehicle 1 came to final rest, on the left shoulder of the roadway. Utilizing digital photography, 62 photographs of the entire scene and vehicles involved were taken. Measurements were taken by hand utilizing a measuring wheel. The area of impact was determined to be in lane number 2 based on the scene evidence which included the deceased finger in the roadway. Section IV. - Vehicle(s) Involved: Vehicle #1: 2016 Toyota Camry (VIN #: 4TBBF1FK3GR543384) The silver Toyota Camry was displaying Maryland registration 7EW9219. The vehicle was operated and registered to Moctar Moustapha Tall (African American/male, DOB:06/14/1998), of Rockville, Maryland The Toyota Camry was observed positioned in its position of controlled final rest on the left shoulder of the roadway. The front passenger side of the vehicles windshield sustained heavy damage. The passenger side roof of the vehicle sustained two dents near the top of passenger side door as well as blood on the rear door and window on the passenger side. The front passenger windshield damage was initiated in the front where the initial impact with pedestrian occurred. (reference photographIMG-4620.jpg, IMG-4622.jpg,IMG-4625.jpg) Vehicle #2: 2020 black Ford Explorer (VIN #: 1FM5K8GC0LGB33489) The black Ford Explorer was displaying Maryland registration 57EW9212. The vehicle was registered to Darrell William Brooks Sr. (African American/male, DOB: 4/23/1995) The Ford Explorer was positioned in its position of controlled final rest in lane number 2. The Ford Explorer sustained heavy front-end damage in the front and driver side windshield. The front-end damage was initiated in the front due to the initial impact from the pedestrian. (reference photograph IMG-4613.jpg IMG-4614.jpg). Section V. - Person(s) Involved: Person #1: Pedestrian: (Deceased): Mark Anthony Bumbry (African American/male, DOB: 07/18/1961), of Hyattsville, Maryland. Bumbry was a pedestrian at the time of this incident. Bumbry was attempting to cross the roadway from the left shoulder of the roadway, at which time he was struck by the silver Toyota Camry, then the black Ford Explorer. Bumbry was pronounced deceased by Firefighter/Paramedic- Fakone #21380 at approximately 2159 hours. Bumbry was removed from the scene and transported to the Office of the Chief Medical Center Examiners Office located in Baltimore, Maryland so an autopsy could be conducted. The OCME case number was # 23-0519. The autopsy was conducted on April 23, 2023, at approximately hours by Ami Murphy, Assistant Medical Examiner/D.O. According to the Autopsy, Bumbry died from blunt force injuries due to a pedestrian-motor vehicle collision and the manner of death was ruled as an accident. Toxicology testing was positive for alcohol. Bumbryhad toxicology test resultof .24 BAC. Person #2: Driver of vehicle 1:Moctar Moustapha Tall (African American/male, DOB:06/14/1998), of Rockville, Maryland. Tall was the driver of the 2016 Toyota Camry at the time of this incident. At the time of the incident, Tall was traveling in lane number 1. Tall advised the pedestrian attempted to cross the roadway, traveling east in the northbound lane of travel lane number 1. Tall advised his vehicle struck the pedestrian. Tall remained on scene for the duration of the investigation. Person #3: Driver of vehicle 2: Darrell William Brooks Sr. (African American/male, DOB: 4/23/1995), of Randallstown, Maryland. Brooks was the driver of the Ford Explorer in this incident and advised he was traveling north on I-95 in the area of Konterra Drive in lane number 2 at which time he observed a pedestrian in his lane of travel. Brooks advised his vehicle struck the pedestrian. Brooks was administered Standard Field Sobriety test by Trooper C Bowling #7419 which yielded negative results. Brooks remained on scene for the duration of the investigation. Section VI. - Follow-up Investigation: Date: June 7, 2023: On the above date, Office of the Chief Medical Examiner, Jessika M. Logan-Records Library provided the Autopsy and Toxicology report for the deceased in this incident. Section VII. - Analysis of Electronic Control Modules: No electronic modules analyzed in the investigation. Section VIII. - Speed Analysis: No speed analysis data utilized in this investigation. Section IX. - Crash Dynamics: The silver Toyota Camry, being operated by Moctar Moustapha Tall wastraveling on the north on I-95 in the area of Konterra Drive in lane number 1. The black Ford Explorer, being operated by Darrell William Brooks Sr., was traveling on the north on I-95 in the area of Konterra Drive in lane number 2. The pedestrian attempted to cross the roadway, traveling east in the northbound lane of travel lane number 1, occupied by the Toyota Camry. The Toyota Camry struck the pedestrian. Due to the force of impact from the Toyota Camry, the pedestrian was thrown into lane number 2, occupied by the Ford Explorer. The Ford Explorer then also struck the pedestrian. The Toyota Camry came to position of controlled final rest on the left shoulder of the roadway. The Ford Explorer came to position of controlled final rest in lane number 2. The pedestrian came to position of un-controlled final rest in lane number 2. Section X. - Attachments that were included in for this report: -Sixty-one (61) digital photographs were taken and will be uploaded into the VeriPic Digital Evidence System. The following items were attached to this report: - ACRS Report 89 B -- Written Statements. -- Diagram, not drawn to scale. Autopsy and Toxicology Report. Conclusion: The following conclusions are based upon the totality of this investigation, including the statements of person involved, the physical evidence accumulated, as well as the reports submitted by other investigators concerning this incident. My rendering of these conclusions are based upon my training in the field of collision reconstruction. On Friday, April 21, 2023, at approximately 2128hours, the 2016 silver Toyota Camry displaying Maryland registration 7EW9219, operated and registered to Moctar Moustapha Tall, was traveling north on I-95 in the area of Konterra Drive in lane number 1. The black 2020 Ford Explorer displaying Maryland registration 57EW9212, operated by Darrell William Brooks Sr., was traveling on the north on I-95 in the area of Konterra Drive in lane number 2. Mark Anthony Bumbry, the pedestrian at the time of this incident, was attempting to cross the roadway from the left shoulder of the roadway, at which time he was struck by the silver Toyota Camry. Bumbry was thrown into lane number and struck once more by the black Ford Explorer. The collision events were determined to have been caused byMark Anthony Bumbry who was improperly in the roadway. The dark lighting conditions were contributing factors. These collision events led to the death of Mark Anthony Bumbry. This case is closed due to the death of theat-fault party. B. White Trooper First Class #6931 Maryland Department of State Police ACI/Patrol-Forestville Barrack L 3500 Forestville Rd. Forestville, MD 20747
